data.title: With addition of Kiffin and Strong, Sunshine State coaches at new level
data.meta_description: At given times in college football history, the football talent at Florida universities has been staggering. \n But with the recent hirings at South Florida and Florida Atlantic, college coaching in t…
data.text:
At given times in college football history, the football talent at Florida universities has been staggering.

But with the recent hirings at South Florida and Florida Atlantic, college coaching in the Sunshine State is now at an unprecedented level.

A bold statement to be sure, especially considering an era in the 1990s when Bobby Bowden (Florida State), Steve Spurrier (Florida) and Dennis Erickson (Miami) were working at the same time and eventually combined to win five national championships and 19 conference titles.

But the rest of the state’s college programs were going through different challenges at the time, mostly related to attempts to establish some kind of toehold in a state dominated by the three programs Bowden once called “Big Florida.”

Now, fast-forward to the Labor Day weekend of 2017. When the new college football season begins, there will be seven coaches in Florida who have had previous head coaching or coordinator jobs at other Power 5 conference schools, and five who either led staffs or were coordinators for national championship teams.

When South Florida hired Charlie Strong after he was fired at Texas; Florida Atlantic plucked Lane Kiffin away from Alabama, where he was the offensive coordinator; and Florida International brought Butch Davis back from exile into Miami again, it created a dream team of coaches that already includes Jimbo Fisher at FSU, Jim McElwain at Florida, Mark Richt at Miami and Scott Frost at Central Florida.

And prospects in Florida should be prepared for the sales pitches of their lives, from all corners of the state. Every coach has a reputation as a good recruiter and with Kiffin, Davis and Strong now in the mix, “Big Florida” coaches – Fisher, McElwain and Richt – surely can’t relax.

Davis and Strong are returning to the state where they made their initial coaching chops. Davis was the Miami coach from 1995-2000, where he laid the groundwork for the teams that won a national championship in 2001 and reached the championship game in 2002 under Larry Coker. Strong was the defensive coordinator at Florida for two national championships won under Urban Meyer in 2006 and 2008. Strong also had two stints at UF working for Steve Spurrier.

Kiffin also has Florida ties. His ex-wife Layla is a University of Florida graduate and he was an offensive quality-control coach for the Jaguars under Tom Coughlin in 2000.

Oddly enough, three of the coaches (Richt, Frost and Kiffin) were born in Nebraska and none in Florida. Five were college quarterbacks, with Strong and Davis playing on defense. Only Richt is coaching at his alma mater.

Four of the coaches came from coaching trees first planted in Florida, Richt and Fisher from Bowden, Davis from Jimmy Johnson at Miami and Strong having strong ties to Spurrier.

One thing they are likely to have in common: it won’t be dull.

Jimbo Fisher, Florida State

Born: Clarksburg, W.Va.

Player: Samford quarterback.

Head coach: FSU, 2010-present.

National titles: FSU 2013 (head coach); LSU 2003 (offensive coordinator).

Previous state ties: None in coaching but long-standing relationship with Bowden family.

Fired: Left with the rest of Terry Bowden’s staff after Bowden was fired at Auburn in 1998.

Known for: Developing NFL quarterbacks (four first-round picks) and defending Jameis Winston.

What you didn’t know: Played in Arena Football League for the Chicago Bruisers.

Jim McElwain, Florida

Born: Missoula, Mont.

Player: Eastern Washington quarterback.

Head coach: Colorado State, 2012-2014; Florida, 2015-present.

National titles: Alabama, 2009 and 20011 (offensive coordinator).

Previous state ties: None until hired by UF.

Fired: In 2006 from Art Shell’s staff with Oakland Raiders.

Known for: Running offenses and developing quarterbacks at such diverse places as Montana State, Michigan State, Louisville, Alabama and Fresno State.

What you didn’t know: College roommate with radio/TV sports personality Colin Cowherd.

Mark Richt, Miami

Born: Omaha, Neb.

Player: Miami quarterback.

Head coach: Georgia, 2001-2015; Miami 2016.

National titles: FSU, 1993 (QBs coach) and 1999 (coordinator).

Previous state ties: Played at Miami 1979-1982; graduate assistant at FSU 1985-1988.

Fired: From Georgia at end of the regular season in 2015.

Known for: Being Jim Kelly’s backup at Miami and coaching two Heisman Trophy quarterbacks, Charlie Ward and Chris Weinke.

What you didn’t know: He and his wife Katharyn have adopted two children from the Ukraine.

Scott Frost, Central Florida

Born: Wood River, Neb.

Player: Stanford and Nebraska quarterback.

Head coach: UCF 2016.

National titles: None as a coach. Played for Nebraska’s 1997 national championship team.

Previous state ties: Played for Tampa Bay Buccaneerss in 2003.

Fired: Never.

Known for: Playing and coaching under Bill Walsh, Tom Osborn, Bill Belichick, Bill Parcells and Jon Gruden.

What you didn’t know: Became the 10th player in NCAA history to run and pass for 1,000 yards or more in the same season.

Charlie Strong, South Florida

Born: Batesville, Ark.

Player: Central Arkansas defensive back.

Head coach: Texas 2014-2016; Louisville, 2010-2013.

National titles: Florida 2006 (co-defensive coordinator) and 2008 (coordinator).

Previous state ties: Was graduate assistant for UF in 1983-1984; coached under Galen Hall 1988-1989 (outside linebackers), and Steve Spurrier from 1991-1993 (defensive ends) then again in 1994 (defensive tackles).

Fired: From Texas after the close of 2016 regular season.

Known for: Coaching at UF during four separate time periods and at three defensive positions. Was defensive coordinator for Ron Zook and Urban Meyer.

What you didn’t know: Was 5 feet 3 and 130 pounds when he began playing high school football. Later, in college, he returned an interception 100 yards for a touchdown.

Lane Kiffin, Florida Atlantic

Born: Lincoln, Neb.

Player: Fresno State quarterback.

Head coach: Oakland Raiders, 2007-2008; Tennessee 2009; USC 2010-2013.

National titles: USC 2004 (wide receivers coach); Alabama 2015 (coordinator).

Previous state ties: Jaguars assistant in 2000.

Fired: Twice. Oakland Raiders owner Al Davis fired him over the telephone in 2008 after an ugly and public falling out. USC AD Pat Haden fired Kiffin at the L.A. International Airport in 2013, before Kiffin had a chance to get on the team bus going back to the campus after returning from a 62-41 loss at Arizona State.

Known for: Being a brilliant offensive play-caller and creating controversy at nearly every coaching stop he’s made – except Alabama.

What you didn’t know: In addition to football, Kiffin played basketball and baseball at Fresno State.

Butch Davis, Florida International

Born: Tahlequah, Okla.

Player: Arkansas defensive end (played only one season due to knee injury).

Head coach: Miami, 1995-2000; Cleveland Browns, 2001-2004; North Carolina, 2007-2010.

National titles: Miami, 1987 (defensive line coach).

Previous state ties: UM assistant under Jimmy Johnson from 1984-1988 in addition to returning as Hurricanes’ head coach.

Fired: From the Browns in 2004. From North Carolina in 2011 after NCAA allegations of academic misconduct and players receiving benefits from agents.

Known for: Recruiting and coaching Miami players such as Ray Lewis, Ed Reed, Andre Johnson, Clinton Portis, Edgerrin James, Reggie Wayne and Jeremy Shockey, many of whom formed the nucleus for UM 2001 national championship team.

What you didn’t know: Coached with Jimmy Johnson at Oklahoma State, Miami and the Dallas Cowboys.
